article: I often see some homeless people on the corner of the street. It used to make me uncomfortable to see them, and I had to ask myself, "  _  ?" Then, one day I saw a homeless person. I parked my car and got out. I went up to him and asked him what would make him happy. "A hot cup of  _  ," he told me. So we walked across the street to a little dinner and I bought him a cup of coffee, and some bread and eggs. He talked, and I  _  . I told him now I used to look through people like him, but that day, I had decided to open my eyes and to really see the world. I told him he was the  _  homeless person I had ever spoken to. After our meal together, I asked him if there was anything else that would make his life a bit  _  . He said the only other thing he wanted was just a new pair of socks. Socks, really? He said he'd been wearing the same pair  _  a few weeks. There are always clean socks in my dresser drawer. I actually happened to be wearing a nice and new pair of socks at that very moment. I told him that I wanted to give him the pair I was wearing  _  he wouldn't mind. I had only been wearing them for a few  _  . At first, my new friend  _  . I told him it would make me happy if he would take  _  . Finally, he agreed. He was very happy to wear my socks. Now, I always have an extra pair with me in my car. They are always my best pair, just waiting to be given away...
